items.title: Arizona’s Supreme Court is now using AI-generated reporters. Here’s why
items.summary:
- Arizona Supreme Court introduces AI-generated avatars, Victoria and Daniel, to deliver news on court rulings.
- The initiative aims to enhance public trust and understanding of judicial decisions.
- Chief Justice Ann Timmer emphasizes the need for improved communication following backlash from a controversial abortion ruling.
- Videos produced by the avatars are designed to explain court decisions more clearly and quickly.
- AI-generated reports take about 30 minutes to produce, compared to hours for traditional videos.
- The court explores various emotional delivery styles and translations to engage a wider audience.

items.title: EV maker BYD launches new, ultrafast charging system
items.summary:
- BYD has introduced an ultrafast EV charging system capable of a full charge in five to eight minutes.
- The company plans to establish over 4,000 charging stations across China, addressing major concerns around charging times.
- BYD's new charging solution can offer up to 400 kilometers of range in just five minutes of charging.
- The technology utilizes silicon carbide power chips and operates at voltages up to 1,500V.
- BYD produced over 4.3 million new energy vehicles last year, marking a 41% increase from the previous year, outpacing Tesla in 2024 production.

items.title: The most innovative companies in applied AI for 2025
items.summary:
- Generative AI models have improved productivity for businesses as employees utilize AI tools like chatbots and coding assistants.
- In 2024, startups such as [Glean](http://glean.com/), [Contextual AI](https://contextual.ai/), and [Blackbird.AI](https://blackbird.ai/) gained traction with innovative AI solutions.
- Glean's Work AI platform, launched in June 2024, allows employees to generate tailored answers across 100+ data sources, raising $460 million and achieving a $4.6 billion valuation.
- Anysphere’s Cursor tool provides context-aware coding assistance, amassing over 40,000 customers and attaining a $2.6 billion valuation.
- Blackbird.AI's Compass platform (released in 2024) helps organizations monitor reputation through AI analysis of social media content.
- Google DeepMind received the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for AlphaFold models, predicting protein structures to aid drug discovery.
- DeepL serves over 150,000 organizations with accurate translations and real-time communication tools, raising its valuation to $2 billion in May 2024.
- Perplexity offers an AI-powered search revamping web search while adding features for election information coverage ahead of the U.S. elections in November 2024.
- Contextual AI focuses on retrieval-augmented generation for more precise AI systems, securing $80 million Series A funding in August 2024.
- Harvey innovated the legal assistance field with its AI tool capable of document analysis and drafting, aiming to improve reliability in legal workflows.

items.title: The most innovative companies in artificial intelligence for 2025
items.summary:
- 2024 marked significant progress toward artificial general intelligence (AGI) in AI industry.
- OpenAI introduced the o1 model focusing on real-time reasoning, which outperformed previous models.
- Nvidia's stock rose by 171% in 2024 due to demand for GPUs and the introduction of the Blackwell architecture.
- Google DeepMind released the Gemini 2.0, a multi-modal AI model capable of processing various types of data.
- Anthropic launched Claude 3.5 Sonnet enabling computer use within AI tasks.
- Microsoft debuted small language models Phi-3 and Phi-4, achieving new benchmarks in reasoning and logic tasks.
- Amazon AWS released the Trainium2 processor to compete with Nvidia GPUs for AI training and inference.

items.title: The 10 most innovative augmented and virtual reality companies of 2025
items.summary:
- Innovative organizations are enhancing AR/VR for practical technology interaction and skill training.
- Notable companies include Texas A&M University, Excurio, and Varjo, leveraging AR/VR for education and training.
- Xreal launched Xreal Air 2 Ultra AR glasses for $699, achieving significant sales and funding.
- Squint developed AI-powered AR training tools, improving efficiency for companies like Ford and Michelin.
- Excurio created immersive VR experiences for museums, attracting over 2 million visitors globally.
- Varjo's VR headsets received FAA approval for pilot training, with expansion into military applications.
- FundamentalVR’s platform enhances surgical training with real-time feedback and AI support.
- Rembrand uses AR to revolutionize product placements in videos, enhancing visibility for clients like PepsiCo.
- Haiku’s role-playing games train users in cybersecurity, narrowing the gender gap in the field.
- Unity continues to support AR/VR development across platforms, launching new tools for enhanced user interaction.

items.title: The most innovative companies in automotive for 2025
items.summary:
- Recognizes both upstarts and incumbents innovating in automotive for 2025.
- Highlights advances in electric vehicle (EV) technology and driverless ride-sharing services.
- Features major players like Waymo, BYD, and Rivian for their contributions to safety, affordability, and efficiency in the EV market.
- Emphasizes the importance of battery safety and recycling with companies like UL Solutions and Mercedes-Benz taking lead roles.
- Notes the ongoing development of digital features by Nvidia and Qualcomm to enhance user experience in vehicles.

items.title: These 10 biotech companies are changing how we discover new drugs and treat complex diseases
items.summary:
- This year's biotech companies highlight the impact of AI and advances in clinical treatment.
- ALZpath has developed a blood test that can diagnose Alzheimer’s disease before symptoms appear, with commercial use by Roche expected.
- GeneDx is addressing rare diseases in newborns by conducting genomic screenings through a large-scale study aiming to screen 100,000 babies.
- 10x Genomics is enhancing single-cell analysis tools, launching 10 products to improve efficiency in research.
- Protagonist Therapeutics is developing oral peptide drugs for plaque psoriasis with promising clinical trial results.
- Recursion is advancing its AI-driven drug discovery platform and has secured a partnership with Roche for its neuroscience research.
- Basecamp Research is building the largest genomic database of Earth’s biodiversity and promoting fair benefit-sharing with local communities.
- Nabla Bio uses AI to design novel antibodies and has secured substantial deals with major pharmaceutical companies.

items.title: The 10 most innovative computing companies of 2025
items.summary:
- Companies supporting AI infrastructure see a surge in innovation and revenue.
- Notable mentions:
  - **IBM**: Expanded quantum computing ecosystem, debuted efficient quantum systems, and gained 600,000 registrations for quantum usage.
  - **Lambda Labs**: Launched 1-Click service for instant GPU clusters for AI training, used by major companies and raised $320 million in funding.
  - **TSMC**: Launched state-of-the-art 3 nm processing technology with improvements for AI chips, achieving record revenue in 2024.
  - **SambaNova Systems**: Introduced SambaNova Cloud, focused on AI inference, adding several high-profile clients.
  - **Aligned Data Centers**: Rolled out innovative cooling technology and has extensive data center development plans.
  - **SiMa.ai**: Developed multi-modal AI chips for edge applications, focusing on energy efficiency.
  - **Oxide Computer**: Started selling plug-and-play cloud computers for secure local data processing, with notable government clients.
  - **NextSilicon**: Launched Maverick-2 chip for high-performance computing, focusing on dynamic hardware reconfiguration based on needs.

items.title: The most innovative companies in consumer electronics for 2025
items.summary:
- Smartphones remain central to digital lives; new innovations focus beyond the touchscreen.
- EssilorLuxottica enhances smart glasses with Meta Ray-Bans and Nuance Audio hearing aids, selling 2 million since Oct 2023.
- Bose introduces Ultra Open Earbuds, allowing outside sounds while providing comfort and quality.
- GE Appliances' indoor Smart Smoker allows barbecue cooking without outdoor appliances.
- Ozlo, a startup, revives sleep earbuds with enhanced features, raising $12 million for future models.
- Apple's Vision Pro, a $3,500 headset, showcases AR advancements and developers' potential.
- Oura Ring 4 introduces new health-tracking insights, particularly benefiting women.
- ESR’s cooling phone chargers improve efficiency and battery health, enjoying 92% revenue growth.
- Swarovski Optik’s AX Visio binoculars provide offline wildlife identification, enhancing birding experiences.

items.title: The 10 most innovative data science companies of 2025
items.summary:
- Highlights the competitive landscape in data science amid an AI boom.
- Features 10 companies embracing data science to make a positive impact:
  - **Unstructured**: Transforms raw data into AI-ready formats for various sectors, including the U.S. military.
  - **Chainalysis**: Enhances transparency in the crypto industry, recovering over $11 billion in illicit funds.
  - **Airbyte**: Simplifies data integration for AI projects, achieving significant revenue growth and widespread adoption.
  - **Norstella**: Aids pharmaceutical companies with data analytics for faster drug development.
  - **Makersite**: Improves sustainability in manufacturing through data-driven insights.
  - **Anaconda**: Expands Python's use in data science with tools that enhance accessibility.
  - **Satelytics**: Uses satellite data to detect methane leaks, enhancing environmental sustainability.
  - **EarthDaily**: Promotes sustainability in mining through data science innovations.
  - **Nominal**: Develops a platform for testing in critical sectors like aerospace and defense.

items.title: The most innovative companies in finance and personal finance for 2025
items.summary:
- This year's finance honorees are recognized for their adoption of artificial intelligence, blockchain, and customer-centric practices.
- **Nubank** is leading the Brazilian banking sector by launching features for families and teenagers, capturing 15% of new customers with its Under 18 account.
- **Stash** introduces an AI-powered Money Coach to assist first-time savers, providing personalized financial guidance.
- **Robinhood** achieves record revenues by attracting active traders and offering subscription services like Robinhood Gold, reporting high trading volumes.
- **Airwallex** connects Western buyers to Asian suppliers and expands globally, executing payments in over 150 countries and targeting a 2026 IPO.
- **Human Interest** simplifies retirement benefits for small businesses with its Fast Track service, rapidly growing its customer base and revenue.
- **Moniepoint** enhances payment processing for African businesses, raising $110 million in Series C financing while achieving significant transaction growth.
- **Comun** targets Spanish-speaking immigrants with accessible banking solutions, significantly increasing its user base and processing a billion dollars in annual payments.
- **Figure** utilizes AI and blockchain to revolutionize the home equity line of credit process, aiming for an IPO after achieving profitability.

items.title: How these 10 gaming companies are keeping players engaged in inventive ways
items.summary:
- The video game industry faced significant layoffs and flat growth in 2024, following a pandemic-related boost in sales.
- Innovative companies have emerged, showcasing unique gaming strategies to engage players.
- **EA Sports** launched *College Football 25*, becoming the top-selling sports game in the U.S., integrating real college athletes into the game.
- **Bandai Namco** released *Tekken 8*, featuring an advanced tutorial mode that adapts to players' styles.
- **LocalThunk**'s *Balatro* became a viral success with over 2 million sales due to its unique poker-style gameplay.
- **Game Science**’s *Black Myth: Wukong* achieved massive sales, elevating China's game development on the global stage.
- **Our Odyssey** introduced *Overjoyed*, a tool for gamers with disabilities to enhance accessibility.
- **Inworld AI** developed an AI engine for dynamic NPC interactions in games, improving player engagement.
- **Pocket Worlds**' *Highrise* allows users to create and explore unique virtual spaces, showcasing the potential of user-generated content.

items.title: The 10 most innovative logistics companies of 2025
items.summary:
- Fast Company highlights the most innovative logistics companies for 2025, including Celonis, Yale Lift Technologies, Altana, and Fleetio.
- Nuvocargo launched an AI-powered supply chain software that improves visibility and reduces customs fees for cross-border shipments between the U.S. and Mexico.
- Kojo unveiled features to help construction contractors track tools and automate invoicing, significantly saving costs and reducing errors.
- Fleetio's software enhances fleet management efficiency, tracking fuel and vehicle maintenance, and integrates EV charge tracking.
- Celonis' platform provides businesses with tools to visualize supply chain workflows and optimize processes, aiding major brands like PepsiCo.

items.title: The most innovative companies in manufacturing for 2025
items.summary:
- Advances in manufacturing are often incremental rather than breakthroughs.
- Blackline Safety improves gas detection with real-time monitoring devices.
- Kraft Heinz enhances its supply chain using machine vision and digital twin modeling.
- Stratasys excels in additive manufacturing, introducing fast 3D printers for complex aerospace components.
- Gelato and Keychain build online marketplaces for on-demand printing and packaged goods.
- Dirtt Environmental Solutions customizes modular construction for commercial facilities.
- P2 Science launches sustainable cosmetic ingredients derived from upcycled materials.
- Keychain leverages AI to connect CPG brands with qualified manufacturers quickly.
- Blackline Safety's new monitor enables real-time hazardous gas detection, enhancing worker safety.
- HT Materials Science develops an additive to improve HVAC system efficiency.

items.title: Why these 10 medical device makers are the most innovative in the world
items.summary:
- The medical devices industry is experiencing an unprecedented technology boom fueled by AI.
- HistoSonics offers the Edison histotripsy system, received FDA clearance in October 2023, with a 95.5% effectiveness rate in treating liver tumors.
- Heartflow uses an AI platform for comprehensive heart diagnostics, achieving 95% accuracy; utilized in 84% of top heart hospitals in the U.S.
- ROMTech has developed the PortableConnect for telemedicine rehabilitation, helping over 98,000 patients and saving costs compared to traditional therapy.
- Xenco Medical’s TrabeculeX Continuum aids in spinal surgery recovery, launched in January 2024, has been adopted in 52 hospitals.
- SprintRay enables rapid in-office dental prosthetics creation, sold over 7,000 devices in 2024, impacting nearly 600,000 patients.
- Cala Health’s Cala kIQ addresses essential tremors, 89% efficacy noted in a study with Medicare coverage across all states as of 2024.
- Medtronic received FDA clearance for its PulseSelect system for treating atrial fibrillation, benefiting 20,000 patients.
- Virtual Incision's MIRA robotic system for minimally invasive surgery received FDA approval, and was tested in space.
- The article recognizes the ongoing innovation in the medical device sector, highlighting significant advancements and their implications for patient care.

items.title: From cancer vaccines to COPD treatments, these 10 companies are developing innovative medicines
items.summary:
- In 2024, breakthroughs in drug treatments included Eli Lilly's Kisunla for Alzheimer's approved in July.
- Bristol Myers Squibb's Cobenfy receives FDA approval as the first new schizophrenia drug in 70 years in September.
- ARS Pharmaceuticals launched Neffy, a needle-free epinephrine nasal spray, in late September 2024.
- Notable advancements in cancer treated include T-cell therapies from Iovance and Adaptimmune.
- Verona Pharma's Ohtuvayre, approved on June 26, 2024, provides a new treatment for COPD.
- Pfizer's Hympavzi approved as a once-weekly treatment for hemophilia in October 2024.
- Innovative immunotherapy Anktiva gains FDA approval for bladder cancer in April 2024, enhancing effectiveness of BCG therapy.

items.title: The most innovative companies in robotics and engineering for 2025
items.summary:
- The global robotics market expected to exceed $100 billion by 2025, up from $17 billion a decade ago.
- Companies producing indoor robots include FANUC and Apptronik, while outdoor applications include Percepto and CNH.
- Simbe Robotics recognized for its Tally robots that improve retail inventory management, raising $50 million in funding.
- Apptronik develops humanoid robots like Apollo, collaborating with Nvidia and Google for AI integration.
- Flock Safety utilizes drones for police work, resulting in significant reductions in emergency response times and crime scene monitoring.
- GrayMatter Robotics enhances robot efficiency with AI to anticipate malfunctions, leading to higher productivity.
- CNH's agricultural robots leverage AI for precision farming, improving efficiency and reducing fuel use.
- Percepto's “drone-in-a-box” solution automates industrial inspections and monitors environmental hazards.
- Performance Drone Works develops military drones that incorporate lessons from conflicts and have received significant contracts from U.S. military.

items.title: The 10 most innovative security companies of 2025
items.summary:
- Fast Company highlights innovative security companies for 2025, including Abnormal Security, Nozomi Networks, Huntress, and Shift5.
- Cybercriminals netted over $9 trillion in 2024, making cybercrime a massive economy.
- Huntress protects over 150,000 customers with automation and monitoring, achieving $100 million in annual recurring revenue.
- Shift5 secures critical vehicles from cyber threats and anomalies, doubling revenue and customer base.
- Nozomi Networks introduced Arc Embedded to secure industrial control systems.
- Axiado offers hardware-based AI-driven solutions to enhance data center security and efficiency, raising significant funding.
- Abnormal Security leverages AI to detect fraud in communication apps, expanding rapidly with major financing and growth.

items.title: The Most Innovative Companies in Space for 2025
items.summary:
- The list reflects global efforts in diversifying and securing launch and orbital services, essential for national security.
- SpaceX successfully launched its Starship and achieved a midair catch landing of its Super Heavy booster stage.
- Rocket Lab sent 12 Electron rockets into space, becoming the number three launch provider globally, and secured significant contracts.
- Arianespace successfully test-launched its Ariane 6 heavy-lift rocket as a step towards independent European space access.
- Iceye expanded its SAR microsatellite constellation, providing high-resolution coverage for various clients, including the U.S. Department of Defense and Ukraine.
- Innovations included a next-generation satellite bus deployment by Apex and weather-monitoring satellites from Muon Space.
- Intuitive Machines became the first private company to land on the Moon in February 2024.
- Questek developed superalloys for SpaceX’s Super Heavy boosters, and Stardog advanced AI for NASA programs.
- Skylo provided satellite connectivity services for major cellular providers to enable emergency communication.

items.title: How DeepSeek engineered a hyper-efficient rival to ChatGPT
items.summary:
- DeepSeek ranked No. 12 on the World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies of 2025.
- Released two AI models that significantly reduce the computing power and capital requirements compared to Western models.
- Innovated mixture-of-experts architecture to enhance efficiency in model training and content generation.
- Developed a smaller model, DeepSeek-R1, utilizing reinforcement learning from its larger model, DeepSeek-V3.
- Shared research methods and open-sourced models, promoting transparency in cutting-edge AI.

items.title: Glean’s AI platform learns everything to know about your company—and offers ways to help out
items.summary:
- Glean is ranked No. 6 on Fast Company’s list of the [World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies of 2025](https://www.fastcompany.com/most-innovative-companies/list).
- The platform provides an LLM-powered assistant that helps employees access and utilize internal data more effectively.
- Glean released [Glean Work AI](https://www.glean.com/product/overview) last year, allowing users to create AI agents for routine tasks using simple prompts.
- The company achieved an annual recurring revenue of $100 million in 2024 and raised $460 million in funding, bringing its valuation to $4.6 billion.

items.title: Nvidia, already the backbone of the AI boom, has big plans for the future
items.summary:
- Nvidia ranked No. 2 in Fast Company's World’s 50 Most Innovative Companies of 2025.
- Company has a 93% market share of GPUs running AI workloads as of Q3 2024.
- The newly launched Blackwell processor is up to 2.5 times more powerful and more energy-efficient than its predecessor.
- Major clients include Google, Meta, Microsoft, OpenAI, Tesla, and xAI, purchasing Blackwell GPUs in large quantities.
- Nvidia is expanding into platforms for drug discovery, autonomous vehicles, video production, and digital twins.

items.title: 3 Tech Advancements to Be Nervous About
items.author: Lindsey Witmer Collins
items.summary:
- The article discusses three technologies that may bring about concerns: humanoid housekeeping robots, AI characters, and Microsoft’s Majorana 1 chip.
- Humanoid robots present risks, such as potential unauthorized actions due to the ease of jailbreaking AI systems used in them.
- AI characters on social media raise issues about the authenticity of interactions, particularly affecting children and leading to potential misinformation.
- Microsoft’s Majorana 1 chip signals advances in quantum computing, highlighting the need for quantum-resistant algorithms to protect data amid the potential for disruption from state and non-state actors.

items.title: Rising demand for hyper-personalization in digital finance
items.summary:
- The financial services industry is experiencing fragmentation, with consumers shifting between multiple platforms.
- Deloitte's 2024 banking outlook warns that retail customers have many choices, making account switching easier.
- Financial ecosystems are evolving to offer bundled value-added features alongside traditional products, enhancing consumer experience.
- The rise of e-commerce demonstrates consumer preference for one-stop shopping, influencing financial service expectations.
- Data analytics and AI can be leveraged to tailor financial options and improve customer loyalty and trust in a fragmented market.
- The industry must evolve to provide a unified, seamless financial experience to retain customer loyalty in a competitive landscape.

items.title: Hollywood warns about AI industry’s push to change copyright law
items.summary:
- Over 400 members of the entertainment community, including notable figures, warn against AI companies' attempts to change copyright laws.
- The group submitted an open letter to the White House Office of Science and Technology expressing concerns about AI companies not paying copyright holders for training data.
- They argue that weakening copyright protections could harm the $229 billion U.S. entertainment industry, threatening over 2.3 million jobs.

items.title: The Internet’s Obsession with Luigi Mangione Is Testing Reddit’s Limits
items.summary:
- Luigi Mangione, accused of murdering UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, has become an internet phenomenon since December.
- The subreddit r/popculture was suspended for approving violent comments about Mangione, leading to community outrage.
- Reddit clarified there is no sitewide filter on the name 'Luigi', and suspensions were due to approving comments advocating violence.
- Despite restrictions, other subreddits like r/FreeLuigi remain active and claim to promote updates on Mangione's case without endorsing violence.
- Reddit's safety team warned users against upvoting violent content, with possible future consequences for such actions.

items.title: Robinhood launches prediction markets hub
items.summary:
- Robinhood launched a prediction markets hub allowing customers to trade on event outcomes.
- The hub includes predictions like the expected upper limit of the Federal Reserve funds rate in May.
- Robinhood's shares rose 6% in afternoon trading following the launch.
- Event contracts gained popularity since the U.S. presidential election, enabling bets on various outcomes.
- The launch marked Robinhood's entry into a market where it faced both enthusiasm from traders and criticism likening it to gambling.
- In February, Robinhood canceled Super Bowl betting contracts after regulatory pushback from the CFTC.

items.title: What is an autopen, and why is Trump obsessed with it?
items.author: Chris Morris
items.summary:
- Donald Trump claimed that Joe Biden's pardons are void because they were signed by an autopen.
- Autopens have been used by several presidents, starting with Harry Truman.
- Trump raised concerns about the legitimacy of Biden's pardons, stating they were done without Biden's knowledge.
- The autopen is a device that duplicates signatures using a robotic arm and pen, differing from digital signatures.

items.title: Bumble adds an ID verification feature to win over cautious daters
items.summary:
- Bumble introduced a new ID verification feature to enhance user safety, available in 11 markets including the U.S., Canada, and Mexico.
- The ID verification requires a government-issued ID and provides a badge on profiles for verified users, allowing others to filter by ID verification.
- Additional safety features include "Review Before You Send," which prompts users to review flagged messages, and the "Share Date" feature for sharing date details with selected contacts.
- Bumble is addressing user safety amid declining app revenue and increased competition from rivals like Match Group, which owns Tinder and Hinge.

items.title: TikTok’s Tunnel Girl is digging again—much to the internet’s delight
items.author: Kala
items.summary:
- TikTok's ‘Tunnel Girl’, known as Kala, has received permission to resume her tunnel project after it was previously shut down due to lack of permits.
- Kala has gained a following of over 657,000 on TikTok by documenting her digging project in Herndon, Virginia, which she began as a hobby in 2022.
- The tunnel currently extends 22 feet below ground and features a 30-foot entrance; future expansion may require additional permits and engineering evaluations.

items.title: Netflix built an army of servers to stream TV—now it’s powering games
items.summary:
- Netflix established its own content delivery network, Open Connect, distributing over 18,000 servers across 175 countries.
- The company is developing cloud gaming infrastructure to enable Netflix members to play games on smart TVs without consoles.
- Netflix's servers have evolved significantly, improving performance by 40 times since their inception in 2011, incorporating modern technology for efficient streaming.

items.title: Relying on AI chatbots for hospital care is ‘reckless and dangerous’ say human nurses
items.summary:
- Hospitals increasingly using AI to monitor patient vital signs and assist with care plans, raising concerns among nursing unions.
- National Nurses United organized over 20 demonstrations advocating for nurses' rights in AI usage and protection from automated advice.
- AI can cause false alarms and dangerous advice; nurses emphasize the importance of human judgment in patient care.

items.title: How TikTok is emerging as an essential tool for migrant smugglers
items.summary:
- Social media apps like TikTok are increasingly used by migrant smugglers and migrants, providing insights into the smuggling industry.
- Smugglers adapt to changing environments and use technology to reach new audiences, moving away from traditional networks.
- A significant 2023 UN study found that 64% of migrants had access to smartphones and the internet during their journey to the U.S.
- TikTok content features alarming trends, with posts advertising smuggling services and showcasing the conditions faced by migrants.
- Concerns are raised by authorities regarding the sophistication of smuggling networks and the potential for exploitation of migrants through social media.

items.title: ‘Everything’s Computer’: How Trump’s Tesla bit sparked a meme frenzy
items.summary:
- Tesla owners are protesting against Elon Musk by disguising their cars with fake badges and joining Facebook support groups.
- Donald Trump hosted a Tesla car show at the White House, supporting his DOGE administrator, and delivered a humorous line: "Everything’s computer!"
- The phrase went viral, creating a new catchphrase in online culture, with reactions from social media users expressing both annoyance and humor.

items.title: Why Erika Ayers Badan is turning Food52 into a media lab
items.summary:
- Erika Ayers Badan discusses her transition to running Food52 after leaving Barstool Sports.
- Highlights the significance of her new podcast, *Work*, which shares insights on generational differences and workplace dynamics.
- Badan emphasizes the importance of candor in business and how it connects to Food52's community and product strategy.
- She expresses support for in-person work, suggesting it fosters resilience and interpersonal skills that remote work may inhibit.
- Discusses the challenges of navigating volatility in business amid governmental changes and the role of business leaders in societal dynamics.

items.title: 12 late-stage startups with 324 remote jobs to fill
items.summary:
- Remote work is becoming a permanent fixture in the job market.
- Late-stage startups are highlighted as stable options with growth potential.
- The article lists companies like Grafana Labs, Vercel, and Headway that are hiring for various remote positions across different sectors such as AI, health, and cybersecurity.
- Grafana Labs has 50 remote roles available in diverse fields from engineering to marketing. [See more](https://grafana.com/about/careers/open-positions/)
- Vercel offers 37 remote positions focused on web application development. [See more](https://vercel.com/careers?location=United+States)

items.title: The private sector is rolling over for Donald Trump
items.summary:
- Trump claims an electoral mandate despite losing the 2024 election significantly, with a declining stock market and public approval.
- Major companies are showing support for Trump, contrary to previous resistance seen after the 2016 election, with significant donations to his inaugural fund.
- Top tech CEOs and media moguls, including Bezos, Zuckerberg, and Cook, are engaging with Trump to secure favorable government contracts and avoid regulation.
- Companies are rolling back diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) programs due to Trump's opposition to them, while some organizations maintain their commitments.
- Concerns are raised about free speech following incidents at Columbia University related to Trump's funding cuts and actions against student activists.

items.title: Angry Americans are hitting Trump where it hurts the most: Elon Musk
items.summary:
- Donald Trump hosted a press conference to promote Tesla, during which he praised Elon Musk and promised to buy a Tesla car.
- Protests against Musk have escalated, leading to demonstrations outside Tesla showrooms and acts of vandalism targeting Tesla properties.
- Tesla shares have dropped significantly, affecting Musk's net worth, which decreased from $500 billion to around $315 billion.
- Trump promised to treat vandalism against Tesla as "domestic terrorism" and criticized those protesting against the company.

items.title: This free web-based image editor gives Photoshop a run for its money
items.summary:
[ AI image editing is currently popular, but traditional image editors are still essential. ]
[ Many devices lack good image editors beyond basic functionalities. ]
[ Photopea is a free, browser-based image editor that requires no accounts or payments to use. ]
[ Photopea can be accessed from any device for quick image editing. ]

items.title: M4 MacBook Air 2025 review: The perfect laptop for most consumers
items.summary:
- Apple unveiled the new M4 MacBook Air laptops, including a 15-inch model with 16GB memory and 512GB storage.
- The M4 chip offers "23x faster performance" compared to older Intel chips, but minimal speed gains over the M2 and M3 in everyday tasks.
- The laptops feature upgrades beneficial for remote workers, although many improvements are just slight spec increases.

items.title: ‘I caught a baby wombat’: U.S. influencer Sam Jones was roundly condemned for her wildlife stunt in Australia
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- U.S. influencer Sam Jones filmed herself taking a baby wombat from its mother in Australia, sparking widespread outrage.
- The video showed her holding the distressed animal, while laughing was heard in the background.
- Jones claimed she returned the baby wombat unharmed, defending her actions against criticism.
- A petition for her deportation gained over 39,000 signatures, leading to reports that she has left Australia.

items.title: You can now watch a full Metallica concert on Apple Vision Pro
items.summary:
- Apple Vision Pro users can watch Metallica's 2024 Mexico City concert with immersive 180-degree video and Spatial Audio.
- The concert was filmed on September 29 during the sold-out finale of Metallica’s M72 World Tour.
- The concert features fan favorites like “One” and “Enter Sandman.”
- Apple claims the experience feels like being front row, backstage, or even on stage with the band.
- The Vision Pro launched in early 2024 but has seen lukewarm sales.
- Apple is now rolling out features to attract everyday consumers, utilizing advanced filming technology for the concert experience.

items.title: How Influencer Brandon Edelman made $768,000 in a year—and what he actually took home
UN report reveals alarming extent of Iran’s increased surveillance of women
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Iran relies on electronic surveillance and public reporting to enforce mandatory hijab laws.
- The UN report comes after protests sparked by the death of Mahsa Amini, citing ongoing systematic discrimination against women.
- Surveillance methods include drone monitoring, facial recognition, and a mobile app for reporting hijab infractions.
- Over 618 women have been arrested under the renewed enforcement plan since April 2024, amidst rising social unrest and economic issues in Iran.

items.title: Got a road toll text? Don’t click on this ‘smishing’ scam
items.summary:
- State officials warn about a rise in scam road toll texts attempting to gather financial information.
- These scams, known as smishing, use SMS to trick individuals into sending money or personal data.
- Louisiana Attorney General Liz Murrill confirmed she received a fake toll text and emphasized that it is a scam.
- Even states without tolls, like Vermont, have seen these scams, misleading travelers.
- Cybersecurity firm Palo Alto Networks noted over 10,000 domains registered for such scams.
- The scams impersonate toll services across at least 10 U.S. states and in Ontario, Canada.
- The FBI previously issued warnings about similar scams and advised recipients to report and delete the texts.

items.title: Siri’s delay is an artifact of Apple’s unsure AI footing—and more
Block Party offers tool for optimizing social media privacy
West Virginia football coach Rich Rodriguez isn’t here for locker room dances
items.summary:
- West Virginia football coach Rich Rodriguez discourages locker room dances on TikTok for his players.
- He emphasizes a focus on football rather than social media trends, stating it's not the image he wants for the program.
- Rodriguez allows players to use TikTok but opposes dancing on it, suggesting it distracts from winning games.
- Some critics argue this stance could limit athletes' branding opportunities and infringe on their freedoms.
- Despite Rodriguez's stance, some players continue to balance TikTok popularity with their athletic careers successfully.

items.title: Why DeepSeek’s arrival looks like a key moment for safe AI
items.author: Donnchadh Casey
items.summary:
- The AI industry is rapidly evolving with new tools and features becoming common, particularly with OpenAI's new Deep Research tool. 
- A Gartner forecast predicts that 33% of enterprise software will integrate agentic AI by 2028, significantly up from less than 1% in 2024. 
- 76% of C-suite executives believe their AI cybersecurity measures require improvement, raising concerns over data privacy and security, particularly concerning foreign AI entities.
- The emergence of China's DeepSeek has highlighted security issues in AI and the vulnerability of AI models to attacks.
- Implementing security measures alongside AI development is crucial as bad actors often exploit new technologies for malicious purposes.

items.title: Social media addicts: Here are tips to stop wasting time on apps
items.summary:
- Many smartphone users spend excessive time on social media apps like Instagram and TikTok.
- Social media and smartphones can be addictive, making it difficult to reduce usage, especially for younger individuals.
- Suggested techniques include deleting time-wasting apps and utilizing built-in screen time controls on smartphones.
